name: Brougher, Appellant, v. Schenck et al.

judges: Before Jones, C. J., Eagen, O’Brien, Pomeroy, Nix and Manderino, JJ.
parties: Brougher, Appellant, v. Schenck et al.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
Decree affirmed. Costs on the appellant.
Mr. Justice Egberts took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: William H. JSfeff, Jr., with him D. Reed Anderson, and Stock and Leader, for appellant.

Eugene R. Campbell and O. Franklin Rothwell, with them Daniel K. Medill, Paul C. Mode wry, Jr., Fluhrer, Medill é Shelley, Smith & McClewry, and Sughrue, Roth-well, Mion, Zinn & Maepeak, for appellees.

Brougher, Appellant, v. Schenck et al.
Argued May 26, 1972.
Before Jones, C. J., Eagen, O’Brien, Pomeroy, Nix and Manderino, JJ.
William H. JSfeff, Jr., with him D. Reed Anderson, and Stock and Leader, for appellant.
Eugene R. Campbell and O. Franklin Rothwell, with them Daniel K. Medill, Paul C. Mode wry, Jr., Fluhrer, Medill é Shelley, Smith & McClewry, and Sughrue, Roth-well, Mion, Zinn & Maepeak, for appellees.
